2) Appointments ( 3 )
when you're good at those things, they ask "why aren't you able to get a contract"
when you're getting contracts and stay on top of your team, they say " you're not doing appointments and talk time ".

headline: Couldn't leave with a happy heart inspite of giving more than a year to this organisation!
pros:
1) Access to your managers & the higher-ups. 
2) Salary is on time. 
3) Loads to learn about marketing techniques & enduring patience in yourself. 
4) Training, Admin & the IT Departments are very supportive.
cons:
Ok where to start... There's no recognition for what you do. All they care is what's the SALE!!! Even if you perform they will never applaud you but just in case you don't, they will bring you into the limelight & managers will hurt your ego by bracketing you as a non-performer. KPI evaluation is not channelized & falls prey to micro management. Same old clients with no approach or proper strategy towards achieving something new or different. The company was doing quite well in the start due to its genuine nature but with time as it grew, it just bothers about selling & no focus on the improvisation of the customer services. The more money you loot from the customer, the better..!!!  Except for a few higher-ups, there are no commendable managers to look up to.. Most of them are limited to only Justdial's product knowledge. Doesn't value an employee's personal life and literally you have to beg for leaves every time you want to take an off or go on a holiday.
